quizSynopsis: Test your knowledge on economics concepts like supply and demand, price elasticity, consumer theory, and income / substitution effects.

questions.question: What does the Demand Curve measure?
options: Willingness of consumers to buy the good
Willingness of producers to sell the good
questions.answer: Willingness of consumers to buy the good

questions.question: What is market equilibrium?
options: Intersection of supply and demand curve
When demand is higher than supply
When supply is higher than demand
questions.answer: Intersection of supply and demand curve

questions.question: What causes the supply and demand curves to shift?
options: Shocks to the ability of producers to supply
Changes in price of complement/substitute goods

questions.question: What is the effect of perfectly inelastic demand?
What characterizes a good with perfectly elastic demand?
options: Its price doesn't affect its demand
Its demand doesn't affect its price

questions.question: What fundamental assumptions are made about consumer preferences?
options: Preferences are complete, transitive, and non-satiated
questions.answer: Preferences are complete, transitive, and non-satiated

questions.question: What happens when income rises for normal goods?
options: Their consumption remains the same or increases
questions.answer: Their consumption remains the same or increases

questions.question: What influences a consumer's optimal bundle of goods?
options: Point of tangency between the indifference curve and the budget line
questions.answer: Point of tangency between the indifference curve and the budget line

questions.question: What are the effects of an increase in wage rate in labor supply?
options: It has both an income effect and a substitution effect
questions.answer: It has both an income effect and a substitution effect
